content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is trying to move Joey’s chair and not having much luck at it as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know I was thinking of moving the couch over here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would you want to do that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So that there will be a decent place for me to sit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, there is a decent place to…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And your lap does not count! Okay? Come on, help me move this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No. No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Rosita does not move.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, Rosita? As in…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: As in Rosita does not move.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, it’s just a chair! What’s the big deal?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The big deal is that it is the exact equal distance from the bathroom to the kitchen and it’s at the perfect angle so you don’t get any glare coming off of Stevie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Stevie the TV?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is there a problem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! (Joey sets his beer and bag of chips down and heads into his room.) Oh what does he know! Come on Rosita, us chichas got to stick together! (She tries pulling on the back of the chair, until the hinge breaks and the back falls off.) You bitch!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are on the couch talking. Phoebe is getting coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know what’s weird? After you guys get married, when you introduce me to people you’re gonna have to say, “This is my brother-in-law Ross.” Not, “My friend Ross,” “brother-in-law Ross.” That’s weird isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Couldn’t I just say, “This is Ross?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, do whatever you want.
(Phoebe sits down between Chandler and Ross.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Ross! So, I was checking out the uh, real estate section…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at this. (Hands him the newspaper.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it looks like mom and dad’s house. Oh, it even has a tree with a broken limb out front and the uh, the window in the attic is…Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? What happened to the window in the attic?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe mom and dad are selling the house!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe they-they didn’t even tell us!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe I still don’t know what happened to the window in the attic!
(Ross calls his parents on his cell phone.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, hello dad! Monica and I just saw the house in the paper! (Listens) Yes we’re surprised! (Listens) Who did you leave a message with?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry! (Runs off.)
content.parenthetical: knocking on the window while outside

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is examining the injury to Rosita while Rachel is apologizing to him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, Joey I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I told you not to move it! Rach, how would you feel if say, I wanted to move your mom, and you said don’t, and I did it anyway and her head fell off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, come on—Joey, I’ll buy you a new one! All right? We’ll go down to the store right now and we’ll-we’ll get you a new chair.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s not even cold yet!
content.parenthetical: slowly turning and glaring at her

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But don’t you think Rosita would’ve wanted you to move on? I mean y’know, she did always put…your comfort first.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s true.
(Rachel turns for the door and makes the “Wow!” face.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay? You ready?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I… (Shuts off the TV.) I don’t want Stevie to see her like this.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Ross and Monica are still going on about the house.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe we have to say goodbye to the house we grew up in. Man, some-some stranger’s gonna be living in my room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, after 15 years of mom and dad keeping it as a shrine to you, it’s time the velvet ropes came down.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They kept your room for a while.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh please! Dad turned my room into a gym 20 minutes after I moved out! I gotta say, a tanning bed and a stack of Victoria’s Secret catalogues, not a gym!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, you know they love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: As much as they love you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was their first born! They thought she was barren! It’s not my fault.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, I hate this year!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s wrong with this year?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well okay, it’s already February and I’ve only given two massages and they were both the worst tippers in the world!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was me and Ross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know if you want to pick up some extra cash? Some friends of mine made good money doing telemarketing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s a great idea. You’re really good on the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah and yeah, and it would probably be better than the last telephone job I had. Y’know, I probably wouldn’t have to say spank as much. (Monica and Ross are shocked.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, like you never called!

content.description: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is getting shown to her desk by the supervisor.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: So basically this is very easy. You read from the script and try to sell as much toner as you possibly can.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I can do that! Oh, by the way, I love my office.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: Why don’t we do a trial run.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay. Umm, all right. (Picks up the phone and starts reading from the script.) Hi, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please?

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: I’m the supply manager.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, okay I would like to talk to you about your toner needs.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: We don’t need any toner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay, well I’m sorry to bother you. Bye-bye. (Hangs up the phone.) Yeah you’re right, this is easy.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: Okay, what was wrong with that call?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, all right…um, no offense, but you were kind of rude.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: They’re always going to tell you they don’t need toner, but that’s okay because whatever they say, you can find the answer to it here in this script.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: So, I think you’re ready to sell toner, do you have any last questions?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. (Pause) Oh wait yes! I do, I do have one question. What is toner?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Chandler is entering.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey! Joe! (Sees that he’s not here and starts investigating. He picks up the bag of chips.) Full bag. (He picks up the beer.) Beer’s still cold. Something terrible must’ve happened here! (He decides it’s not that important; sits down on Rosita, and the back falls off causing him to flip over.) Oh no-no-no-no-no-no! (Runs over to Stevie.) Stevie, I was never here! (Runs out.)

content.description: Ross and Monica’s parent’s garage, Ross and Monica are arriving to go through their things. Mr. Geller is in the garage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’m here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hi. God, it seems like just yesterday you guys used to come out to watch me work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, we-we can’t believe you’re selling the house.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, it’s time for a new family to start their memories here and hopefully their check will clear before they find the crack in the foundation and the asbestos in the ceiling.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s grab our stuff and get the hell out of here.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’m sorry we can’t store your childhood things anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s okay, I can’t wait to see everything again! All of the memories…

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, I don’t know what’s in the boxes down here, but I do know there are six or seven Easy Bake Ovens in the attic.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I used to love to play restaurant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, not as much as you used to love to play uncooked batter eater.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, it is unreasonable to expect a child to wait for a light bulb to cook brownies! (She goes to the attic.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: So, I think your boxes are over here. (They walk over to them.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Great! (Finds a pack of cigarettes.) Wait, dad who-who’s cigarettes are these?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I don’t know. They-they must be your mother’s, but please, please don’t ask her. I’ll throw these away. (He puts them in his pocket as Ross finds something of interest in one of his boxes.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cool! Dad! My report cards! Hey, check this out dad, (reading his grades) Math, A. Science, A. History, A. Gym…(He puts it away and finds something else.) Oooh, my rock polisher!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh look, look there’s your old makeup kit!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a clown kit! Clown kit!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, the white seems to be untouched. (He throws it back into the box as Mr. Geller moves a tarp and makes a discovery.) Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Y’know how the garage floods every Spring?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How are you ever going to sell this place?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I think I accidentally used Monica’s boxes to keep the water away from the Porsche .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no. Dad! Dad! What…(He goes to open one of her boxes and it rips apart.) Oh God…everything’s ruined! Dad, she’s gonna be crushed!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You don’t secretly smoke do you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: So it’s just your mother then.

content.description: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is hard at work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, this Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please? (Listens) Earl, thanks. (Listens) Hi Earl, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies I’d like to talk to you about your toner needs. (She’s reading from the script.)
[Cut to Earl’s office, who is played by Jason Alexander, George from Seinfeld. They cut back and forth between Phoebe’s and Earl’s offices with each of their lines.]

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: I don’t need any toner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m hearing what you’re saying, but at our prices everyone needs toner.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Not me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: May I ask why?

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: You wanna know why. You wanna know why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I surely do!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Okay, I don’t need any toner because I’m going to kill myself.
(Phoebe desperately tries to find the scripted response to that line.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, is-is that because you’re out of toner?

content.description: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is still talking to Earl.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Okay, so…no toner today. Thanks anyway, bye-bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no wait-wait! I can’t just let you hang up! Just please talk to me.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Well…I only have one thing to do today. (He looks at his board in his office that reads, “Today’s Tasks: KILL SELF.”) I guess I could push it back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Now, why do you want to kill yourself?

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: It’s just that I uh, have been working for ten years now at this meaningless, dead-end job and nobody here even knows I exist!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: I-I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No look, I-I’m sure that people know you exist!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Oh yeah? I work in a cubicle surrounded by people. I’ve been talking to you for five minutes now about killing myself and no one’s even looked up from their desk. Hang-hang on. (To the people standing around his cubicle.) Hey everybody! Uh, I’m gonna kill myself! (There’s no response; no one even looks up.) I’ll get back to ya. (To Phoebe) I got nothing. Wait. (He sets the phone down.) Uh, hey Marge! (Mimes putting a gun to his head, pulling the trigger, and splattering his brain on the wall behind him. Then points to himself. Marge watches this, then goes back to work.) (To Phoebe) Ehh, nothing. Nothing.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Chandler has replaced Rosita with his chair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My chair. Now, if anybody asks, your name is Rosita! (He runs out the door, grabs the back of Rosita, and we can hear Joey and Rachel talking as they are coming up the stairs. Neither of them have reached the landing yet.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You will like it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No I won’t.
(Chandler runs to check on them coming up the stairs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t even know!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because, I know what I like and what I don’t like! It’s not the same thing!
(Chandler throws the back of Rosita into his apartment and quickly starts pushing the base into his apartment.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well look, if you don’t like this…(The audience’s laughter at Chandler’s progress cuts out the rest of Rachel’s line.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know why you say that so soon.
(Joey and Rachel reach the landing just as Chandler closes the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Joey, I just bought you a new chair! The most expensive one in the store! Hey, y’know what I was thinking? We could name her Francette.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Francette? What is she? A couch?
(They enter their apartment.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Poor thing. Cut down in her prime.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, the new chair will be here in an hour. Maybe we should actually move Rosita out of here. Y’know, start the healing process?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I guess you’re right. Maybe, maybe I’ll take her down to the incinerator. It’s gonna be so sad, and kinda cool. (He goes to remove the back, but it doesn’t come off. So he sits down in it, puts his feet up, stands up, and looks back at it.) She’s healed!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s weird.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No it’s not weird, it’s a miracle!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not a miracle Joey! I’m sure there’s some explanation.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh there is! If you want something enough and your heart is pure, wondrous things can happen!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, I really don’t…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can you tell me how this happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Miracle!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, y’know what? Maybe somebody came in here and fixed it! Or something!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Someone like an…angel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right Joey, the chair angel came in and healed your chair. (She sits down in the chair.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get your non-believer ass outta my chair! (She gets up and heads for her room.)

content.description: The Geller’s Garage, continued from earlier. Ross and Mr. Geller are still deciding what to do.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, she’ll understand right? It’s not like I did it on purpose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, that won’t matter to her. Look, all my stuff is safe and dry and all hers is-is, is growing new stuff! See, this is exactly the kind of thing that makes her think you guys love me more than you love her.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh my God, does she really thinks that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, can you blame her?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well I don’t know, I-I suppose we may have favored you unconsciously, you were a medical marvel! The doctor said your mother could…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, dad I don’t want to hear about it.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, not right now. Okay look, Monica came here for some memories and damnit, we’re gonna give her some! Okay, grab…grab some empty boxes. Okay? We’ll-we’ll take stuff from mine and whatever we can pass off as hers we’ll-we’ll put ‘em in there.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Like uh y’know like this! This! (He picks up one of those art projects that kids make in kindergarten and first grade.) She-she could’ve made this!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right? And this! (He picks up a trophy) She-she could’ve won this!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: This could’ve been hers!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure! Ooh-ooh, what about this?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Your make-up kit? I’d feel better.
(Ross angrily throws the kit into one of Monica’s new boxes.)

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting on the now healed Rosita as Rachel is sitting in the newly arrived Francette. Francette is one of those new chairs from La-Z-Boy that has and does everything except cook and go to the bathroom for you. It’s got a small refrigerator under one armrest, it has phone jacks for the Internet and regular phone, and so much more.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am so psyched I kept this chair for myself!
content.parenthetical: grabbing a beer out of the chair’s fridge

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, me too. (He flips up his armrest in disgust.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, how’s…how’s the uh, miracle chair?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah? Wow! Y’know, that this thing has speakers in the headrest!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! You can hook it up to your TV and you get radio!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My chair heals itself.

content.description: The telemarketing office, Phoebe is still trying to talk Earl out of suicide.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Earl, you’re not hearing me! All I’m saying is that you’re not alone, alright? Everybody hates the people they work with! (One of her coworkers overhears that, and she mimes that she didn’t mean him.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Hey guy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, what was that? That sounded like someone being nice to you.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: No! That’s just the “Hey Guy” guy. He says that to everybody! He’s the worst! I’d like to take him with me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. So Earl, let’s just forget about the people at the office, okay? There-there’s gotta be someone else in your life worth sticking around for! What about-what about your family, your friends, or maybe your girlfriend?

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Yeah! Right!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh sorry, boyfriend!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, whatever! Anything!

content.speaker: The “Hey Guy” Guy
content.text: Hey guy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, he’s gotta go.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Okay, I should, I should probably be getting back to my thing now. See ya. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! I’m not finished yet! Don’t! Don’t you dare hang up on me!!!

content.speaker: Supervisor
content.text: (to the rest of the staff) The new girl’s good.

content.description: The Geller’s Garage, Mr. Geller and Ross are finishing up recreating Monica’s memories as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys! Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I just whipped us up some Easy Bake treats, they should be ready in about three days.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: That’s a good one! Do you hear that Ross? Three days!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! (Laughs.) Oh, this will make a great memory.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. So, which boxes are mine?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, these. These are yours right here. (Pointing to the boxes they just created for her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Starting to go through them) Oh! A coloring book! (Holding it up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, oh you loved that thing. You always had it with you. You never went anywhere without-without that coloring book.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Wow! It looks like I had some trouble staying inside the lines.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nu-uh! (Grabs it and examines it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, an old glove?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh, yeah you loved that glove! You took it every place you went. You never went any place without that glove.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Look at this! (Picking up a shirt.) I can’t believe I even fit into this shirt! (She holds it up and it reads: Tyrannosaurus Ross.) (She turns it around and looks at it.) Oh, this is yours. (Hands it to Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I don’t know how that got in there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This isn’t mine. (Sets it down and looks at the rest of the boxes.) Hey, this isn’t, this isn’t my stuff! Ugh, Ross! (Grabs and holds up a doll.) These are your boxes! Where are my boxes?
content.parenthetical: holding up a small cowboy hat

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, your boxes are umm…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, the garage flooded sweetie and it ruined everything in your boxes. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just mine?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’m afraid so.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So why-why wasn’t Ross’s stuff ruined? (Pause) And if you say the words medical marvel I’m going to Easy Bake your head!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, I used your boxes to divert water away from the Porsche .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So wait, Ross’s stuff is fine, but I have no memories because you wanted to keep the bottom two inches of your car away from water!!!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: There was also leaves and guk and stuff.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe this! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Screw it! I’m having one. (Takes out and lights a cigarette.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is writing a letter by the bay window as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How would you like to sit in a chair that fully reclines, has a rolling massage, and speakers in the head rest?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’d love to but I’ve tried that so many times they won’t even let me in the store anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well what if I told you you can do it in my apartment?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you telling me that you bought the chair that is making all other lounge systems obsolete? The chair that Sit magazine called the Chair of the Year?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just purchased the La-Z-Boy E-cliner 3000 . (Which is an actual product by the way, I’m not sure about the 3000 part.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s awesome! That’s great! What made you do it?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it’s a long story, but umm I broke Joey’s chair…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! You broke Joey’s chair?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought I broke Joey’s chair! That’s why I replaced it with mine!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhhh. That’s how it got fixed!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what did you think, that-that elves came in and fixed it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! (Laughs) Angels.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gettin’ my chair back! (Heads for Joey and Rachel’s.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Wh-hey!
(They enter Joey and Rachel’s to find that Joey has broken Chandler’s chair.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it looks like it wasn’t healed after all! Yeah! So, I guess this chair is mine now! (Sits down in it and groans.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey you broke my chair!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your chair?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, he thought he broke your chair so he switched the chairs!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, there was no miracle?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Joe, no miracle.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no this is devastating! My faith is shaken. I’m so glad I have the new chair to get my through this difficult time in my life.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh! Nice try, but you don’t get that chair anymore! All right? That is my chair now! You can sit on my lap! (Joey starts to get up.) No I take that back!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think I should get the chair!
(Rachel and Joey both laugh at that suggestion.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do you figure?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because you (Points to Joey) broke a chair and you (Points to Rachel) broke a chair! The only one around here that hasn’t broke a chair, is me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no-no! This chair’s not going anywhere.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, where’s the logic in that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The logic is, that there are two of us and we are both strong enough to break a chair in half!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So Joey breaks my chair and I get nothing!
(Joey whispers in Rachel’s ear to confirm his response.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you guys? Like a gang or something?!
(They confer again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! We are!
(Rachel whispers in Joey’s ear.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re the Cobras!

content.description: Earl’s Office, Earl has his head in his hands as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me! Can you tell me where I can find Earl? He’s the supply manager around here.

content.speaker: Marge
content.text: Sorry, I don’t know any Earl.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: I’m right here!!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Earl! I’m Phoebe.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Phoebe? The lady who sells toner?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, look it, you-you can’t kill yourself.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Look, um I really appreciate your coming down…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no I can’t! I can’t let you do it!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because it was fate that made me call you today!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: I thought it was toner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Think about it okay? This isn’t even my regular job! Okay? And my first day on the job, you’re my first call! And-and somebody else might’ve hung up on you, but I wouldn’t do that because I know about this stuff. My mom killed herself.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: How?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not gonna give you tips! Look don’t you see that this-this…this all came together so that I could stop you from doing this.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Couldn’t it just be a coincidence?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s fate!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: It doesn’t really seem like enough to be fate.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Well umm, okay here’s a weird thing. My mother was also a supply manager.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: I’m actually the office manager.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! So was she! And! Get this, okay? Your-your name is Earl, right? Her name was Pearl, P-Earl.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Well, was there anything else?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure! (Thinks.) Umm, where are you from?

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Philadelphia.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! So was she! Oh, I’ve got-I’ve got goose bumps. (She holds out her arm.)

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, y’know I’m wearing layers and it’s warm.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Yeah-yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But if—no look, okay. These jerks might not care about you, but the universe does! And that says a lot!

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Did you hear that?! I don’t need you guys to care about me! Because the universe cares! The whole universe! (Laughs as everyone ignores him.) (To Phoebe) I really wished they’d care just a little bit though.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, I don’t-I don’t think it’s you. This is a freaky place. (To All) Hey! Guys! (Everyone looks up.) (To Earl) Oh no, it’s you.

content.speaker: Earl
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: The Geller’s Garage, Monica is picking through her ruined childhood heirlooms with Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, this is terrible! Eve rything is destroyed! Look at this. (She picks up some kind of furry thing.) It obviously meant enough for me to save it, and I don’t even know what it is! Ohh, it’s still soft. (She rubs it against her cheek.) What do you think this is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. I think it was a mouse.
(Monica screams, throws the mouse down, and rubs her hands on Ross’s sweater to clean them.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: How are you honey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you think I am?! You’ve wrecked all my childhood memories. You love Ross more than me. And I just rubbed a dead mouse on my face!
(Ross gets up to let his dad sit next to Monica.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Sweetheart, we love you just as much as Ross! Now, I’m sorry about everything that happened and I’d probably never be able to make it up to you, but here’s a start. (He hands her a small box.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It’s the key to my Porsche . Well, the key to your Porsche .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!!!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’ve been thinking about getting rid of it. I was driving it the other day and saw my reflection in a store window. Your mother’s right, I do look like an ass.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, you’re giving me your Porsche , you’re kidding me right?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well w-w-w-w-wait, w-wait, wait, wait a minute! I mean a couple of stupid boxes get wet and she gets a Porsche ?!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Why don’t we take it for a spin?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, what about me?! I’m a medical marvel!!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is sitting in Joey’s lap on Francette, and they’re both groaning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahhhh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh…… (To Rachel) Eh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you guys know what happened to Chandler’s barcalounger?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, Joey broke it. Had to get rid of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you kidding?! I get a Porsche and the barcalounger’s gone?! This is the best day ever! (Runs out.)
